de.esoco.lib.expression

Class Conversions

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.expression.Conversions

  • public class Conversions
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains factory methods for functions that perform datatype conversions. Most of these functions are invertible functions that can be used to convert values in both directions.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Conversions.DateToStringConversion
      An invertible function that converts a date value into a string and vice versa.
      static class  Conversions.StringConversion<T>
      A base class for conversions that convert values into strings and vice versa.

    • Method Detail

      • asString

        public static java.lang.String asString(java.lang.Object rValue)
        Returns the string representation of a certain value as defined by the string conversion for the value's datatype. The string conversion for a certain type can be queried with getStringConversion(Class). If no conversion has been registered an exception will be thrown. If the value is NULL the returned string will be 'null'.

        Collections and maps will also be converted by invoking this method recursively on the elements or keys and values. They will be separated with the default strings in TextConvert.DEFAULT_COLLECTION_SEPARATOR and TextConvert.DEFAULT_KEY_VALUE_SEPARATOR.

        Parameters:
        rValue - The value to convert into a string
        Returns:
        A string representation of the given value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no string conversion function has been registered for the value's class

      • asString

        public static java.lang.String asString(java.util.Collection<?> rCollection,
                                        java.lang.String sSeparator)
        Returns the string representation of a collection by converting all collection elements with the method asString(Object). The resulting strings will be concatenated with the given separator string.

        It is the responsibility of the invoking code to ensure that the separator string doesn't occur in the converted collection elements. To protect against programming errors this is safeguarded by an assertion at development time.

        Parameters:
        rCollection - The collection to convert into a string
        sSeparator - The separator string between the collection elements
        Returns:
        A string representation of the given collection
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no string conversion function has been registered for one of the collection elements

      • asString

        public static java.lang.String asString(java.util.Map<?,?> rMap,
                                        java.lang.String sEntrySeparator,
                                        java.lang.String sKeyValueSeparator)
        Returns the string representation of a map. This is done by converting all map keys and values with the method asString(Object) and concatenating the results with the given entry separator. These converted map entries will then be concatenated with the separator string to create the result.

        It is the responsibility of the invoking code to ensure that neither the entry separator nor the separator string occur in the converted keys and values.To protect against programming errors this is safeguarded by an assertion at development time.

        Parameters:
        rMap - The map to convert into a string
        sEntrySeparator - The separator string between the map entries
        sKeyValueSeparator - The separator string between the key and value of a map entry
        Returns:
        A string representation of the given map
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no string conversion function has been registered for one of the values in the map

      • enumToString

        public static <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> InvertibleFunction<E,java.lang.String> enumToString(java.lang.Class<E> rEnumClass)
        Returns an invertible function that converts an enum value of a certain enum type into a string and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        rEnumClass - The class of the enum the returned function will convert
        Returns:
        An enum conversion function for the given enum type

      • getStringConversion

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> InvertibleFunction<T,java.lang.String> getStringConversion(java.lang.Class<T> rDatatype)
        Returns a standard string conversion function for a certain datatype class. If no string conversion has been registered for the exact class through registerStringConversion(Class, InvertibleFunction) this implementation will search recursively for a conversion of one of it's superclasses.
        Parameters:
        rDatatype - The datatype to return the conversion function for
        Returns:
        The invertible string conversion function or NULL if none has been registered for the given datatype or one of it's superclasses

      • parseCollection

        public static <E,C extends java.util.Collection<E>> C parseCollection(java.lang.String sElements,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<C> rCollectionType,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<E> rElementType,
                                                                      boolean bOrdered)
        Parses a collection from a string where the collection elements are separated by TextConvert.DEFAULT_COLLECTION_SEPARATOR.
        See Also:
        parseCollection(String, Class, Class, String, boolean)

      • parseCollection

        public static <E,C extends java.util.Collection<E>> C parseCollection(java.lang.String sElements,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<C> rCollectionType,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<E> rElementType,
                                                                      java.lang.String sSeparator,
                                                                      boolean bOrdered)
        Parses a collection from a string where the collection elements are separated by TextConvert.DEFAULT_COLLECTION_SEPARATOR.
        Parameters:
        sElements - A string containing the elements to be parsed; NULL values are allowed and will result in an empty collection
        rCollectionType - The base type of the collection
        rElementType - The type of the collection elements
        sSeparator - The separator between the collection elements
        bOrdered - TRUE for an ordered collection
        Returns:
        A new collection of an appropriate type containing the parsed elements

      • parseMap

        public static <K,V,M extends java.util.Map<K,V>> java.util.Map<K,V> parseMap(java.lang.String sMapEntries,
                                                                             java.lang.Class<M> rMapType,
                                                                             java.lang.Class<K> rKeyType,
                                                                             java.lang.Class<V> rValueType,
                                                                             boolean bOrdered)
        Parses a map from a string with the default map entry separator TextConvert.DEFAULT_COLLECTION_SEPARATOR and the default key and value separator TextConvert.DEFAULT_KEY_VALUE_SEPARATOR.
        See Also:
        parseMap(String, Class, Class, Class, String, String, boolean)

      • parseMap

        public static <K,V,M extends java.util.Map<K,V>> java.util.Map<K,V> parseMap(java.lang.String sMapEntries,
                                                                             java.lang.Class<M> rMapType,
                                                                             java.lang.Class<K> rKeyType,
                                                                             java.lang.Class<V> rValueType,
                                                                             java.lang.String sEntrySeparator,
                                                                             java.lang.String sKeyValueSeparator,
                                                                             boolean bOrdered)
        Parses a map from a string.
        Parameters:
        sMapEntries - A string containing the map entries to be parsed; NULL values are allowed and will result in an empty map
        rMapType - The base type of the map
        rKeyType - The type of the map keys
        rValueType - The type of the map values
        sEntrySeparator - The separator string between the map entries
        sKeyValueSeparator - The separator string between the key and value of a map entry
        bOrdered - TRUE for an ordered map
        Returns:
        A new map of an appropriate type containing the parsed key-value pairs

      • parseValue

        public static <T> T parseValue(java.lang.String sValue,
                               java.lang.Class<T> rDatatype)
        Creates an object value by parsing it's string representation as defined by the method asString(Object).
        Parameters:
        sValue - The string value to parse
        rDatatype - The datatype of the returned object
        Returns:
        The corresponding value object of the given datatype or NULL if the original object was NULL too
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If one of the parameters is NULL
        FunctionException - If the string conversion function fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no string conversion exists for the given datatype

      • parseValue

        public static <T> T parseValue(java.lang.String sValue,
                               RelationType<T> rTargetType)
        Parses a string value for assignment to a certain relation type. Other than parseValue(String, Class) this method will also parse collections and maps. For this it relies on the meta information in the relation type's meta information like MetaTypes.ELEMENT_DATATYPE to determine the target datatypes. If the relation type has the flag MetaTypes.ORDERED set an ordered collection will be created.
        Parameters:
        sValue - The string value to parse
        rTargetType - The relation type that defines the target datatype of the conversion
        Returns:
        The parsed value with a datatype suitable for assigning to the relation type
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If parsing the string fails

      • registerStringConversion

        public static <T> void registerStringConversion(java.lang.Class<? super T> rDatatype,
                                                InvertibleFunction<T,java.lang.String> rConversion)
        Registers a string conversion function for a certain datatype in the global registry. This will replace any previously registered function for the given datatype. Functions registered through this method can be accessed globally through the method getStringConversion(Class).

        It is possible to register functions for a base type of certain datatypes because the lookup in getStringConversion(Class) works recursively. In such a case the application must ensure that the registered function can also restore the correct sub-type upon inversion of the function.

        Parameters:
        rDatatype - The datatype to register the string conversion for
        rConversion - The string conversion function
